Articles.Content:
I'm glad to show you my latest creation (a.k.a. the-rocket-that-didn't-explose-on-liftoff), the Gladium VI!

It's a 3 stage rocket, born to be lightweight and to bring Bob, Jeb and Bill in a stable orbit. It uses modded parts (E-600 engines and KSP srb) because they're fucking awesome .

The initial launch is fantastic. Pretty stable and the KSP boosters give enough thrust to the rocket (first stage final speed is about 200m/s)

At about 7000m staging happens and I continue with the last two stages.

The second last engine speeds up the rocket to the necessary orbital velocity.

As you can see I have enough fuel to come back, even too much. (Really the lander isn't necessary, but I love to orbit with two stage and leave one in the space lol)

After some orbiting I staged, speeding down to de-orbit.

And here it is, my last but useless stage (not counted cause it really does nothing) that I love so much. It's just a little solid rocket booster (Sunday Punch mod) that spins the capsule in a kerbasome way

The srb has another function: it scares even Jebediah while exploding under the capsule! Without killing them of course, just shouting the module few meters away.

In this mission however my glorious kerbanauts died due to the terrain bug, R.I.P. guys ;_;

The next achievement is to do liftoff-orbiting-deorbit-landing-liftoff again - re orbiting-deorbit and landing at KSP.

Thank you for reading this 'another-rocket-topic' written in this freakin' ugly english.

Happy exploring!
Nice! Now try to make a rocket that performs this well with Vanilla parts.

Nice! Now try to make a rocket that performs this well with Vanilla parts.

Ahah that's my project right now !
I'd like to download this, as I'm terrible at making rockets. However, it seems you don't have an attachment with your .craft file.

Oh, I'm sorry i forgot to upload it.

Here it is! However you need to download Sunday Punch mod and Excelsior engines.

Good day sir
(From the far future, in 1.0.5) Just went into this end of the spacecraft exchange, nostalgic as crap.

The necro is strong.... VERY STRONG. Dude, feel free to look at these threads, but really try not to comment too many of them. It brings it all up on the list for us to see, and clutters the actually relevant threads :)

I did play quite this long ago, but yea... Pretty retro

I think this long-dead thread can be put to rest. With extreme prejudice.
